oai_dc:dc.dc:title: View of Capitol Hill and State Capitol, 1962
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Photograph of the Tennessee State Capitol, 7 February 1962. Constructed between 1845 and 1859, the State Capitol was designed in the Greek Revival style by architect William Strickland. Strickland died before construction was completed and was interred in the walls of the north portico. His son, Francis W. Strickland, oversaw the completion of the project. The Capitol was placed on the National Register of Historic Places in 1970. Photographed by the Nashville Housing Authority. Forms part of the MDHA Photograph Collection. 1 photograph : b & w.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Nashville Housing Authority (Nashville, Tenn.); Tennessee State Capitol (Nashville, Tenn.);
